resourceProperties.name: contributor
resourceProperties.description: Contributor or contributors to the resource. It is likely that the target resource will be a foaf:Person but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: creator
resourceProperties.description: Creator or creators of the resource. It is likely that the target resource will be a foaf:Person but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: created
resourceProperties.description: Timestamp of resource creation

resourceProperties.name: description
resourceProperties.description: Descriptive text about resource represented as rich text in XHTML content. SHOULD include only content that is valid and suitable inside an XHTML <div> element.

resourceProperties.name: identifier
resourceProperties.description: A unique identifier for a resource. Typically read-only and assigned by the service provider when a resource is created. Not typically intended for end-user display.

resourceProperties.name: modified
resourceProperties.description: Timestamp of latest resource modification

resourceProperties.name: relation
resourceProperties.description: Relation which identifies a related resource.

resourceProperties.name: subject
resourceProperties.description: Tag or keyword for a resource. Each occurrence of a dcterms:subject property denotes an additional tag for the resource.

resourceProperties.name: title
resourceProperties.description: Title of the resource represented as rich text in XHTML content. SHOULD include only content that is valid inside an XHTML <span> element.

resourceProperties.name: name
resourceProperties.description: The full name of a person expressed as simple text string.

resourceProperties.name: givenName
resourceProperties.description: Given name of person expressed as simple text string.

resourceProperties.name: familyName
resourceProperties.description: Family name of person expressed as simple text string.

resourceProperties.name: type
resourceProperties.description: The resource type URIs

resourceProperties.name: member
resourceProperties.description: OSLC domains might define a number of member or contains relationships between resources. The rdfs:member property is suitable for use when only one such relationship needs to be defined, or when no additional semantics need to be implied by the property name

resourceProperties.name: serviceProvider
resourceProperties.description: A link to the resource's OSLC Service Provider. There may be cases when the subject resource is available from a service provider that implements multiple domain specifications, which could result in multiple values for this property.

resourceProperties.name: instanceShape
resourceProperties.description: The URI of a Resource Shape that describes the possible properties, occurrence, value types, allowed values and labels. This shape information is useful in displaying the subject resource as well as guiding clients in performing modifications. Instance shapes may be specific to the authenticated user associated with the request that retrieved the resource, the current state of the resource and other factors and thus should not be cached.

resourceProperties.name: shortTitle
resourceProperties.description: Shorter form of dcterms:title for the resource represented as rich text in XHTML content. SHOULD include only content that is valid inside an XHTML <span> element.

resourceProperties.name: shortId
resourceProperties.description: Shorter form of dcterms:identifier for the resource, such as a number.

resourceProperties.name: discussedBy
resourceProperties.description: A series of notes and comments about this resource.

resourceProperties.name: modifiedBy
resourceProperties.description: The URI of a resource describing the entity that most recently modified the subject resource. The link target is usually a foaf:Person or foaf:Agent, but could be any type. This is modeled after dcterms:creator, but Dublin Core currently has no equivalent property.

resourceProperties.name: describes
resourceProperties.description: This shape describes resources that are of any of these types. Formally, a shape S applies to a resource R if there is a triple R rdf:type T and there is a triple S oslc:describes T.

resourceProperties.name: property
resourceProperties.description: The properties that are allowed or required by this shape.

resourceProperties.name: allowedValue
resourceProperties.description: value allowed for a property

resourceProperties.name: allowedValues
resourceProperties.description: Resource with allowed values for the property being defined.

resourceProperties.name: defaultValue
resourceProperties.description: A default value for property, inlined into property definition.

resourceProperties.name: hidden
resourceProperties.description: A hint that indicates that property MAY be hidden when presented in a user interface

resourceProperties.name: isMemberProperty
resourceProperties.description: If set to true, this indicates that the property is a membership property, as described in the Query Syntax Specification: Member List Patterns. This is useful when the resource whose shape is being defined is viewed as a container of other resources. For example, look at the last example in Appendix B's RDF/XML Representation Examples: Specifying the shape of a query result, where blog:comment is defined as a membership property and comment that matches the query is returned as value of that property.

resourceProperties.name: name
resourceProperties.description: Name of property being defined, i.e. second part of property's Prefixed Name

resourceProperties.name: maxSize
resourceProperties.description: For String properties only, specifies maximum characters allowed. If not set, then there is no maximum or maximum is specified elsewhere.

resourceProperties.name: occurs
resourceProperties.description: MUST be either http://open-services.net/ns/core#Exactly-one (property is required), http://open-services.net/ns/core#Zero-or-one (property is optional), http://open-services.net/ns/core#zeroOrMany (property is optional), or http://open-services.net/ns/core#One-or-many (property is required)

resourceProperties.name: propertyDefinition
resourceProperties.description: URI of the property whose usage is being described.

resourceProperties.name: range
resourceProperties.description: For properties with a resource value-type, Providers MAY also specify the range of possible resource types allowed, each specified by URI. The default range is http://open-services.net/ns/core#Any.

resourceProperties.name: readOnly
resourceProperties.description: true if the property is read-only. If omitted, or set to false, then the property is writable. Providers SHOULD declare a property read-only when changes to the value of that property will not be accepted after the resource has been created, e.g. on PUT/PATCH requests. Consumers should note that the converse does not apply: Providers MAY reject a change to the value of a writable property.

resourceProperties.name: representation
resourceProperties.description: Should be http://open-services.net/ns/core#Reference, http://open-services.net/ns/core#Inline or http://open-services.net/ns/core#Either

resourceProperties.name: valueType
resourceProperties.description: See below for list of allowed values for oslc:valueType. If this property is omitted, then the value type is unconstrained.

resourceProperties.name: valueShape
resourceProperties.description: if the value-type is a resource type, then Property MAY provide a shape value to indicate the Resource Shape that applies to the resource.

resourceProperties.name: closeDate
resourceProperties.description: The date at which no further activity or work is intended to be conducted.

resourceProperties.name: status
resourceProperties.description: Used to indicate the status of the change request based on values defined by the service provider. Most often a read-only property. Some possible values may include: 'Submitted', 'Done', 'InProgress', etc.

resourceProperties.name: closed
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the Change Request is completely done, no further fixes or fix verification is needed.

resourceProperties.name: inprogress
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the Change Request in a state indicating that active work is occurring. If oslc_cm:inprogress is true, then oslc_cm:fixed and oslc_cm:closed must also be false

resourceProperties.name: fixed
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the Change Request has been fixed.

resourceProperties.name: approved
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the Change Request has been approved.

resourceProperties.name: reviewed
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the Change Request has been reviewed.

resourceProperties.name: verified
resourceProperties.description: Whether or not the resolution or fix of the Change Request has been verified.

resourceProperties.name: relatedChangeRequest
resourceProperties.description: This relationship is loosely coupled and has no specific meaning. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: affectsPlanItem
resourceProperties.description: Change request affects a plan item. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: affectedByDefect
resourceProperties.description: Change request is affected by a reported defect. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_cm:ChangeRequest but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: tracksRequirement
resourceProperties.description: Tracks the associated Requirement or Requirement ChangeSet resources. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: implementsRequirement
resourceProperties.description: Implements associated Requirement. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: affectsRequirement
resourceProperties.description: Change request affecting a Requirement. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_rm:Requirement but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: tracksChangeSet
resourceProperties.description: Tracks SCM change set resource. It is likely that the target resource will be an oslc_scm:ChangeSet but that is not necessarily the case.

resourceProperties.name: elaboratedBy
resourceProperties.description: The subject is elaborated by the object. For example, a user requirement is elaborated by use case.

resourceProperties.name: elaborates
resourceProperties.description: The object is elaborated by the subject.

resourceProperties.name: specifiedBy
resourceProperties.description: The subject is specified by the object. For example, a requirement is elaborated by a model element .

resourceProperties.name: specifies
resourceProperties.description: The object is specified by the subject.

resourceProperties.name: affectedBy
resourceProperties.description: Requirement is affected by a resource, such as a defect or issue.

resourceProperties.name: trackedBy
resourceProperties.description: Resource, such as a change request, which tracks this requirement.

resourceProperties.name: implementedBy
resourceProperties.description: Resource, such as a change request, which implements this requirement.

resourceProperties.name: validatedBy
resourceProperties.description: Resource, such as a test case, which validates this requirement.

resourceProperties.name: satisfiedBy
resourceProperties.description: The subject is satisfied by the object. For example, a user requirement is satisfied by a system requirement.

resourceProperties.name: satisfies
resourceProperties.description: The object is satisfied by the subject.

resourceProperties.name: decomposedBy
resourceProperties.description: The subject is decomposed by the object. For example, a system requirement is decomposed into a collection of system requirements.

resourceProperties.name: decomposes
resourceProperties.description: The object is decomposed by the subject.

resourceProperties.name: constrainedBy
resourceProperties.description: The subject is constrained by the object. For example, a functional requirement is constrained by a safety requirement.

resourceProperties.name: constrains
resourceProperties.description: The object is constrained by the subject.

resourceProperties.name: uses
resourceProperties.description: A collection uses a resource - the resource is in the requirement collection.
